Even outside of it, it's hard to find work. I feel hopeless and it has made my suicidal thoughts much worse.

I actually plan to do it tonight. I had a shitty birthday and I really don't need to live a day more. Leading up to today, I've broken up with my girlfriend and pushed my family members away from me as much as possible, so it will lessen their pain. It hurts a lot, but it's for their own good.

I've tried therapy and medication, it helped briefly but my psychiatrist told me that my depression will keep coming back easily, I have family history of depression and suicide so it's no wonder. I can't keep going through this and bringing down my loved ones. I can't keep living like this.

I guess the reason I made this post is to vent. I don't know if I'm actually going to go through it tonight. I hope I'll be able to. My feelings have gone numb and I just want to close my eyes forever. I called a suicide hotline and the operator tried to guilt me into staying alive by telling me all about how my family will miss me... I know they will, but it will pass with time. I'm very worried about them, but I can't keep living for them. It's been the only reason I've kept living all these years... I can't do this anymore.

So, tonight might be the end. Sorry for venting. I'm keeping it a secret, obviously, but I felt like I had to tell someone, even anonymously on reddit. Goodbye.

These are the things which are making me miserable -
1. I hate myself. I have no self worth and I cannot see myself as worth loving or being around. 
2. There is a guy I like. We kinda were together for a while, but we were long distance and then we broke. We occasionally text now and even though he acts the way he should (by this, I mean, pretty indifferent), I care more than I should. And that sucks. And even this, I feel very mediocre. And for someone who has always been am over achiever, this kind of just jogging along without proper progress is excruciating.

I wanted to try spoken word poetry, I wanted to do other things and somehow none of those things are working out. It's a lack of opportunity, but it's also a severe lack of motivation as of right now. It's a vicious cycle.
5. My health has become crap. I keep trying to get better, but it's hard and a lack of motivation does not help.
6. I'm financially not doing well. That's not an issue, but my stipend will end before my PhD does, and that fear of the future is terrifying to me.
7. I've lost faith in God. It's like losing a limb. It sucks.
8. I cannot seem to find anyone who I like and who likes me and wants to be with me. I speak of both friends and relationships. I'm literally alone.
9. I'm of no significance to anyone. If I died tomorrow, nobody would even notice. And that's a stupid reason to want to die, but honestly, it makes it harder to want to live.

For my part I think what would be truly noble is to accept reality and go willingly into the great abyss without fear. IDK, my philosophy is dark and shitty and likely doesn't stand up to scrutiny. I need to tell this story. Because nothing has gone right at any stage and I've gone from feeling on top of things to consistently wanting to throw myself off my balcony in the space of a week. I'm a 31 year old male living by myself in a 1 bedroom apartment in the Melbourne metro area. I work as a team leader for a company, currently working from home due to the pandemic. I'm single. I have a condition called acromegaly which requires daily treatment and incurs a lot of medical costs.

Over the last 4 months my workplace has been cutting costs and shedding any jobs they can in order to counter the lack of referrals we've had since la corona kicked off. In this timeframe my workload has tripled. I've gone from looking after a single team of 6 people to managing 20 people across 2 teams and having to liaise with key stake holders far more than I am comfortable. This sort of work is not in my wheelhouse and I've not been comfortable with it. Not that I've had a choice.

This Monday just gone, I had a meeting with my new boss (reporting to her for around 8 days at this stage) and she has casually lumped me with a handful of tasks that I don't know how to get down while juggling my existing workload and meeting all the existing targets I have and I...broke down. I lost my cool, on the verge of tears talking about how this workload is draining me and how this isn't the sort of work I signed up to do. Then it was over and I moved on to my next meeting and continued with my work, miserable but able to continue working. I then get a Zoom call from my boss again and a rep from HR. I attempt to play it off, giving her an update on everything that I've got done in the 45 minutes since we last spoke to no avail.

They advise me to take the rest of the day and Tuesday off because they're "worried about me". I attempt to fight this because a day and a half off isn't going to help me when my workload will be waiting for me when I get back and I really don't want to lose time. I'm told I have no choice as my boss's boss is now involved and they "want to make sure I'm alright". I'm not happy about this but again I have no choice. So I log off and...try to do anything else. Unsuccessfully. I went from being mildly anxious and stressed to full blown depressed in the space of 10 minutes. I spent most of that day and a half sleeping.

Wednesday rolls around and I log on to start my day. I get a call from the HR rep who tells me that I can't come back to work until I've got medical clearance to return. She tells me that our EAP (employee assistance program) or a GP can provide this document. I'm not even remotely happy about this so I channel my inner Karen and email my boss's boss and the HR manager with my concerns in a well written request to have this overturned. It was denied...6 hours later. Boss's boss says that they'll keep my on paid leave until Monday but I need a letter clearing me to return before I can come back. In this time frame I have contacted EAP (twice) and contacted my GP, neither of whom are able to write this letter. My GP gives me a psych referral claiming that they might be able to write said letter. I start looking for psych appointments at short term notice and decide to try my hand with EAP again.

The person I get through to indicates initially that they may be able to help. I talk with them for 20 minutes before bringing up the letter again, to which they advise that they can't provide me something like this. I'm frustrated here, yell something alone the lines of "What's the point of any of this then?!" and hang up. After this I'm feeling lost. I go to the local shopping centre to visit the pharmacy to get some prescriptions filled. I get food on the way home. I get home, sit down and I'm about to eat my food when I get a call on the intercomm. 

It's the Police. EAP called in a welfare check. I politely tell them to piss off and indicate I wont let them into the building. This happened once before (an ex-girlfriend being a possessive pain in the ass) during which when I opened the door a crack to tell them to go away, the shoved their foot in the door and shoved a gas dispenser in my face looking to subdue me. They then forced their way inside. I'm not letting that happen again. 15 minutes after I've told them to go away, they knock on the door having got inside the apartment complex. I again tell them to piss off and refuse to open the door. After some back and forth they offer to have an emergency psych consultant call me to chat. I agree to this hoping this might help me get my letter. No call ever came through. This is still Wednesday.

Thursday rolls around and with no call from whoever the Police said would call, I'm left still looking for a psych appointment. I'm about to give up when at around 2pm, I land a telephone appointment for 7pm that day. I book it in and I finally relax a little hoping that this will finally get me the documentation needed by Monday. 7pm rolls around. Then 7:15. I call the reception for this place, voicemail. I send an email. Nothing. 8pm. I give up. Disheartened once again. Deflated. Dejected. Helpless. I got to sleep.

Friday. 8:30am. I get a call from the receptionist for the company that stood me up. They offer to rebook me for 1pm. I'm elated. Energetic again. I accept. I get a follow up call from the psych apologising for the previous night blaming a scheduling issue. 1pm appointment confirmed. I get up, slightly revitalised. I eat some food and have a shower, suddenly aware it's been a while since I'd done both. I relax and enjoy myself for a few hours until the appointment.

1pm. Got the Zoom invite and jump on a call with the psych. Explain the circumstances and what I need assuming she will then ask me some questions to get an idea about me. I volunteer as much information as I can and explain the outburst as a result of my workload and how work is concerned for my safety. She...doesn't believe that's why work requested said document. She talks about how my manager must have felt threatened by my actions and talked about how I can't go around threatening people in the workplace. She then talks about how my appearance itself must be very threatening and how I should do something to mitigate that by trimming my beard and tying my hair back (I'm a big guy with wild curly hair and a quarantine beard currently). I follow along with what she's saying and try to point out that the outburst was directed inward at myself rather than outward at another person. She doesn't believe me. I express my concerns about the fact that she's not really listening to what I'm saying and rather just pushing what she believes happened. She then says that if we can't communicate then we should end the session now, tells me she wont be charging me and moves to wrap things up. This was at the tail end of a half hour conversation. I try to talk her down citing that I'm not saying these things to disagree with her but because it's important to have a meaningful back and forth and that I was worried she was getting the wrong idea about me. She doesn't care. The session ends. I break down in tears. I go to sleep.

Friday evening. 9:30pm. I don't know what to do. I don't know where I stand or if I'll even have a job on Monday. I can't believe this cancerous week I've had and I'm terrified of what the future holds. With my health issues, I can't afford to be unemployed right now. This genuinely scares me. There's no way I'll be able to enjoy my weekend. I can't eat, I can't enjoy myself. I'm convinced work has done this because they want to get rid of me. I'm so tired of this. I'm tired of everything. I don't want to keep on struggling against the world when the world is clearly telling me I'm not meant to exist. I'm not meant to have a life or stability. I don't know why any of this happened. None of this is fair and I'm mortally tired. I genuinely want to jump. To be free of all of this pressure. To be free of everything. This life has been cruel, unjust and unkind to me.
